name: La Quinta Inn Manhattan

reviews.text: We just stayed at this hotel for a night in the city. We were very pleased with the property. It was so close to Penn Station. Also, it was a short walk toTime Square and other attractions as well as being steps from a subway line. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I loved seeing the Empire State Building from our window! The value was great in a city that is known for being pricey. I plan to stay here again when in NYC.
reviews.title: Clean, close, comfortable, and cold a/c...

reviews.text: We stayed here during a tour of the US in june 2011. When we tried to check in we found they had given our rooms away because my card details had changed. My card details HAD changed but i'd informed La quinta inns a few weeks earlier and they said there would be no problem.
reviews.title: Will happily give your room away

reviews.text: The office staff had said the had e mailed us the day before we arrived (which is not very helpful to travelling foreigners who may not have wifi), to confirm our booking. In fact they had mailed us at 11am on the day of arrival whilst we were travelling from Las Vegas by air.
reviews.title: traveling with baby went well

reviews.text: To travel for several ours just to find your room has been given away is so dispiriting. Some of the staff actually appeared to think this was funny (other staff were better though). Although the manager eventually found us a room in another hotel in the franchises group (Apple Core), the stress ruined our stay in New York.
reviews.title: No problems and a great price

reviews.text: Other than this the hotel is mediocre at best, would stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Best location, it's near everything. Going back again!

reviews.text: The good...about a 5 minute walk from Penn Station, and just a couple of minutes to the Empire State Building. Early check in was available at no extra charge. Very friendly staff was always eager to help and give directions (thanks Tom).
reviews.title: Average hotel...average location

reviews.text: The room was small, but clean. The bathroom was of decent size...very clean. Good working A/C. The breakfast was not so great...other complimentary breakfasts on trip were much better. Plenty of food in area though. There was a CVS Pharmacy 30 seconds out the door. Area felt safe enough.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If carrying bags from Penn Station, I would take 34th Street to 5th Ave, and then south to 32nd....much smoother on the luggage wheels. Hotel is in between 2 subway stops (orange and green)...one line will take you to the Yankees, the other to the Mets games.
reviews.title: BETTER THEN THE LAST TIME

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Not sure where to stay in the city and reading review after review, we just weren't sure which hotel to stay in, that was moderately priced. The staff was very helpful. The room was spacious for a NYC hotel, plenty of storage and a very nice size safe in the room. We were able to fit 2 laptops, a couple handheld games, travel docs and still had room.
reviews.title: Would stay here again: clean, friendly, convenient, safe,

reviews.text: We discovered that there wasn't hot water and that was promptly fixed. We were told the whole floor was out. We arrived at 2 am, so they said if it wasn't fixed by 9 am they would change rooms for us, but we woke to hot water, no problem.
reviews.title: Great Location in K Town

reviews.text: La Quintas are usually nice but this one....not so good.
reviews.title: If a business traveler...look elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the La Quinta in Manhattan for a week in July 2006. I was there for business and expected a business type hotel. Their website stated they had Wifi but there wasn't. To check e-mails and upload reports I had to go down and plug my laptop into their switch down in the business center.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
$139 a nite??
reviews.text: The room was small and the carpet and curtains very dirty and old. The bed was horrible and the AC did not work well which made for a very rough nights rest.
When you call the front desk at night nobody answers and when I called in the morning it took forever to get an answer.
reviews.title: Stay Away from the la Quinta in downtown Manhattan
Great Value - No complaints from me.
reviews.text: In addition, the elevators were slow and constantly malfunctioning.
I travel to NYC on biz very frequently. I happened to hit a very busy hotel week without advance booking ... almost every room in the city was selling for $299 plus a night.
reviews.title: DEpressing!

reviews.text: Decided to take a chance on the $179 room/ night rate for two nights at this hotel.
reviews.title: Think twice before staying here!!
Beware - it is a scam with the low rates
reviews.text: The best features -- 2-block walk from Penn Station for those arriving from Newark on the airport train, and complimentary wireless access.

reviews.title: Perfectly fine.
reviews.text: Everything else was dismal. Arrived to find that they could not find my reservation. Stood at the front desk patiently for 20 minutes (with my online reservation confirmation in hand). Seems like they were encountering a communications breakdown with LaQuinta[-] Finally, the (minimally) English-speaking desk clerk handed me a key to my 5th floor room.
The typical NYC small room featured:
reviews.title: Not bad at all

reviews.text: Came back to this hotel for a second time... lots of little annoying things on this visit have soured me on this place.
reviews.title: Second time wasn't the charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again, the WiFi refused to work in my room. About the only spot on the floor that the WiFi worked was in front of the elevators. The plug-in jack inside the room didn't work at all. It was frustrating to try to get work done in this room.
reviews.title: Stay was okay

reviews.text: The curtains in this room hang directly over the air conditioner, so the air blows up into the curtains and the air doesn't circulate in the room. You have to try to balance things on top of the air conditioner to hold the curtain against the window so you can get some air in the room. That's annoying.
reviews.title: Not the Ritz, but acceptable

reviews.text: It looked like the light fixture over the bed was being held in place with some push pins. I wasn't going to climb up there to find out.
reviews.title: I too was double-billed at La Quinta-Manhattan

likes.disliked: — Rudeness of the two men working at the front desk. Having been double-billed

reviews.text: Yes, it's a mid-priced hotel, but now that there's a Holiday Inn Express and a Hilton Garden Inn among others in mid-town Manhattan, there are newer nicer properties in the same price range that weren't there a year ago.
reviews.title: Jury's still out on this one!

reviews.text: Good location! Nice staff...rooms a bit on the smaller side (we are a family of four). Would stay again, it was a good stay.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, would stay there again...

reviews.text: Had a fantastic stay at this Hotel. The rooms were clean, and not as small as the normal NYC hotels rooms for the price. The staff were friendly and courteous, and were there to assist you with whatever you needed. Considering I lived in NYC for 27 years, and was back as a tourist, it felt very comfortable to stay here. It was convenient to everything!! I got to hit all the favorite spots in the city from this location. Most of the subway lines are about a block or two from the Hotel. Would stay here again on the next trip back! Overall, it's a really clean well maintained hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel in Koreatown, NYC

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights. Great Value, staff very helpful and professional. Rooms a little small, but clean and tidy. We were there for sightseeing vacation with family from out of the country. Had a great time. YOung woman at information booth was able to get my aunt and cousin tickets to Chicago near the stage, for great price. Breakfast plentiful and filling. Within walking distance to Penn Station, shopping, EMpire state Building, and other sights. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great value, professional staff, great breakfast.

reviews.text: We just returned from a trip to New York and Washington DC, and were very happy with our stay at the La Quinta Manhattan. We drove, and were able to unload all our luggage right in front of the hotel. Parking was close by.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room. It was a larger room with 2 double beds. There was a safe in the closet.
reviews.title: Good value for Manhattan

reviews.text: People who have reviewed this hotel have got it right. This is an efficient hotel in Manhattan, even though the price tag (at least in September) is shockingly high compared to other La Quinta Inns in the U.S. The room we had is indeed much larger than you would expect in Manhattan, and the hotel is well run. Case in point: there is a business center in the basement that offers the free use of a laserJet printer, NOT an ink jet printer. The room is clean and the service very good. There are TWO air conditioners in our room. There are wide window sills that can be used as shelves. It is close to the Penn Station and subway stations.
reviews.title: The reviewers are right

reviews.text: Some minuses: The Internet connection was flaky during our stay, at least in the evenings when perhaps the demand is high. The drawers of the dresser cannot be closed tight. In the bathroom we could faintly smell the exhaust from the kitchen of a very popular Korean restaurant nearby. The door slams noisily when people next ti us leave their rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent budget hotel for NYC Visits

reviews.text: You could do far worse in Manhattan. Still, be prepared for (i) the BIG bill at check out and (ii) LONG waits for the two small elevators, especially on weekend nights when the roof-top bar gets busy.
reviews.title: great location, very clean and comfortable

reviews.text: The La Quinta is an older building completely renovated by the Apple Core Hotel group. Check-in was quick and efficient. The elevators are small and slow. I had an 8th floor room with queen size bed. The room was spotless and the bed linen including the comforter was clean and fresh. The room size is very small with modern furnishings and a closet with a door. There is a 32 large LCD TV. The room is too small to allow use of the luggage racks without interfering with use of the available space. The bathroom was small and included a tub/shower. The bathroom was very clean. The towels are not plush and what I would expect in a budget hotel. The air conditioning is very good but the noise from the unit is noticable. Overall, I heard very little noise from the hallway and none from the street or neighboring rooms. The breakfast included in the room rate is basic with a selection of frash baked goods, yogurt, cereal, some fruit and hard boiled eggs.
reviews.title: Treated Rudely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: located in korea town.... close to macy's and empire state building is around the corner...
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay In Manhattan

reviews.text: The location of the La Quinta is very good - just a few steps from Herald Square. The rooms are well maintained though small, which is to be expected in New York. Rooms facing the backside of the hotel look out to a small inner yard and are quite dark, espacially on the lower floors. We changed rooms from one of those to one facing the street because the smell from the restaurant next door was all over the room as it's air condition exhaust was just about 10 metres below the window. There is a pretty nice rooftop bar. If I were to stay there again I would ensure to book a superior room towards the front side.
reviews.title: OK - But not much more

reviews.text: I stayed at the New York, NY LaQuinta in Manhattan. The room was average for New York City. The bathrooms are extremely small. I stayed there May10th -May 12th, 2006. The worst experience was the double-billing of the room charges. I was billed once on May 12th, then again on May 16th. After trying to resolve this issue with the desk clerk, I tried to contact the manager and left numerous voicemail messages, none of which were returned. I submitted an online complaint to LaQuinta's customer service, and was told they would have a response for me "in a few days." I finally talked directly to the manager on May 23rd, who told me she would "look into it and call me back by 2 PM that day. As of May 27th, I still have not received a return phone call nor has the charges been refunded to my account. Based on the above non-responsiveness of the management and unethical accounting practices, I do not recommend staying here unless you are paying cash. My issue is still unresolved and I the hotel owes me $218, which they have failed to address or refund.
reviews.title: Double-billed at LaQuinta New York, NY
Great Stay
reviews.text: The La Quinta Manhattan is great value for money, We stayed there for 4 nights. Rooms were clean and tidy and staff were very helpfull.
The free continental breakfast was great to get you started.
reviews.title: Review of La Quinta Manhattan

reviews.text: Location is superb , close to subway
reviews.title: Good budget hotel

description: The La Quinta Manhattan offers clean and elegant accommodations with free wireless Internet access, a fitness center, a 24-hour business center, complimentary continental breakfast, free calls within the US and a lot more!
